review_blob:
@ Gollem's Proeflokaal, 7/30/12. Poured in a La Trappe chalice. Moderate, pale tan head, dissipates fairly quickly. Dark, rich, malty, a little earthy, with a sweet, black cherry note. Smooth, full, and rather sweet on the palate. Spices, fruit, earth on complex, lingering finish. Is this the best beer I've ever had? Don't know; I haven't drunk them all. But it's pretty damn good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
